respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN

$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME157 STEP1

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 942283-78-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951763-30-7
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951690-04-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16064817
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME159 STEP1
$RXN

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 942283-78-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951690-06-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16085305
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME161 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 942283-78-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951763-34-1
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951690-09-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16089845
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME163 STEP1
$RXN

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 942283-78-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951763-36-3
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951690-11-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16076511
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME165 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3

respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences

diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 942283-78-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951690-13-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16084883
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME167 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.

synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The

5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated

modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 942283-78-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951763-40-9
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951690-15-6
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16081690
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME169 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

M  V30 MDLV30/STEREL1 ATOMS=(4 14 16 17 18)
M  V30 END COLLECTION
M  V30 END CTAB

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 942283-78-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951763-42-1
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 870-23-5
$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 951690-18-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-254-CAS-16086600
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.

$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction

phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:RCT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 942283-78-5
$DTYPE RXN:RCT(2):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:PRO(1):CAS_RN

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 95
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7087-68-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 14338-32-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(3):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-72-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(4):CAS_RN
$DATUM 76-05-1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 603-35-0
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$RFMT $RIREG SCHEME180 STEP1

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(2):CAS_RN
$DATUM 109-99-9
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The allenoic acids 4 were coupled to the
benzyl alcohol units of the SynPhase-PS lanterns grafted with Wang resin
3 using Mukaiyama's reagent and Hunig's base for 4a/b or Et3N for 4c/d.
The direct use of an unmodified Wang resin minimizes the number of
synthetic operations run on solid support. In addition, our strategy
enabled simple trifluoroacetic acid (TFA)-mediated cleavage to release
the carboxylic acid group, a key functional group in our GGTIs. The
phosphine-catalyzed annulation between solid-bound polymer-supported
allenoates 5 and N-tosylimines proceeded smoothly. The allenoates 5a and
5b were treated with N-tosyltolualdimine and 50 mol% of PPh3 (for 5a) or
PBu3 (for 5b) in benzene at 60 °C to provide the polymer-bound
dihydropyrroles 6. Tetrahydropyridines 7 were formed from the reactions
of 5c and 5d with N-tosyltolualdimine in the presence of 50 mol% of PBu3
at room temperature for 2 and 4 days, respectively. The α ,β -unsaturated
enoate functionalities in 6 and 7 were utilized to further increase the
modularity and number of analogs. For example, the Michael additions of
thiols to 6 and 7 using n-butyllithium as base provided 10 and 11,
respectively, which upon TFA mediated cleavage yielded 12 and 13,
respectively, in 77-95% yield (Scheme 2). These two-step sequences
occurred with high diastereoselectivities, providing the pentasubstituted
pyrrolidine 12 and the tetrasubstituted piperidine 13 as single
diastereoisomeric products. Yield 95%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, solid-supported reaction, stereoselective (in stages 2 and
3), Michael addition in stage 3, Et3N can also be used as alternate base
in stage 1, attachment to Wang linker in stage 1, alternate reaction
conditions also shown in stage 2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Inhibitors of protein prenyltransferases
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Kwon, Ohyun; Tamanoi, Fuyuhiko; Fiji, Hannah; Watanabe, Masaru
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2010014054 A1 2010-02-04

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAS_Reaction_Number
$DATUM 31-307-CAS-11118391
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STEPS
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):STAGES
$DATUM 1
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 94
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):CAT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1314-56-3
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: S,S-Thioacetalization of carbonyl compounds
(general procedure): A mixture of carbonyl compounds (2 mmol), dithiol
(2.2 mmol) or thiol (4.4 mmol) and P2O5/SiO2 (5 mg) was stirred at
ambient temperature. After completion of reaction as checked by TLC, it
was diluted with n-hexane and the catalyst was filtered off. The filtrate
solution (50 ml) was washed with aqueous 10% NaOH (2 x 10 ml) solution
and then dried over anhydrous Na2SO4. The solvent was evaporated by
rotary evaporator and the crude product was purified through a column of
silica gel (n-hexane:EtOAc, 80:20) to obtain the pure product. Entry 7d,
yield 94%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM solid-supported catalyst, silica support used, reusable catalyst, no
solvent
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Silica gel-supported phosphorus pentoxide: a reusable catalyst for
S,S-acetalization of carbonyl groups under ambient conditions
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Shaterian, Hamid Reza; Azizi, Kobra; Fahimi, Nafiseh
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Journal of Sulfur Chemistry (2011), 32(1), 85-91

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The Thioacetalization of Aldehydes and
Transthioacetalization of Acetals in a Solvent General Procedure The
dithiol (3 mmol) or thiol (5-6 mmol)was added to a stirring solution of
aldehydes or acetals (2.5 mmol) in CH2Cl2 (15 mL). Then, anhydrous copper
sulfate (3.5 mmol) was added, and the resulting mixture was stirred at
r.t. for an appropriate time as required for completion of the reaction,
which was monitored by TLC (petroleum ether:ethyl acetate, 4:1). After
separation of the catalyst by filtration, the solvent was removed under
reduced pressure. In all these cases, crude products were sufficiently
pure (TLC and 1H-NMR), and the further pure products were obtained by
crystallization from petroleum ether (b.p. 100-140°C) or PTLC. TABLE 1,
Entry 5, yield 94%

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Diphenyl Disulfide (2a); Typical Procedure. A
round bottom flask was charged with fluorinated solvent (1 mL) and
benzenethiol (1a) (0.110g, 1 mmol). To the solution, 30% aq hydrogen
peroxide (125 μL, 1.1 mmol) was added with constant stirring. The
completion of the reaction was ascertained by TLC or GC. The solvent was
distilled as an azeotrope, and can be recycled, after destroying hydrogen
peroxide with sodium sulfite (0.2 mmol). The residue was washed with Et2O
(3 x 10 mL). The ethereal solution was dried (MgSO4) and concentrated
under vacuum to afford diphenyl disulfide. Product 2m, yield 94%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM 30% H2O2; FLUOROUS SOLVENT
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Oxidation in fluoro alcohols: mild and efficient preparation of
disulfides from thiols

$DATUM Kesavan, Venkitasamy; Bonnet-Delpon, Daniele; Begue, Jean-Pierre
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthesis (2000), (2), 223-225

$DATUM silica-supported
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Thioacetalization and Transthioacetalization;
General Procedure To a stirred mixture of a carbonyl compound (1 mmol) or
an acetal (1 mmol) and alkyl thiol (2.2 mmol) or ethane dithiol (1.2
mmol) in CH2Cl2 (10 mL), activated NaHSO4·SiO2 (200 mg) was added at r.t.
The progress of the reaction was monitored by TLC. After completion of
the reaction, the mixture was filtered and the filtrate was concentrated.
The residue was subjected to column chromatography over silica gel and
the column was eluted with EtOAc-hexane (1:4) to afford pure thioacetal.
The spectral and analytical data of the unknown compound are given below.
4-N,N-Dimethylbenzaldehyde Diethylthioacetal (2e) Light yellow oil, yield
94%. 1H NMR: d = 7.30 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2 H), 6.68 (d, J = 8.0 Hz, 2 H),
4.86 (s, 1 H), 2.98 (s, 6 H), 2.62-2.43 (m, 4 H), 1.16 (t, J = 7.0 Hz, 6
H). EIMS: m/z = 255 [M+], 240, 194, 179, 120. Anal. Calcd for C13H21NS2:
C, 61.18; H, 8.24; N, 5.49. Found: C, 61.32; H, 8.17; N, 5.33.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Studies on novel synthetic methodologies. Part 39. Simple, mild and
efficient thioacetalization and transthioacetalization of carbonyl
compounds and deprotection of thioacetals: unique role of thiols in the
selectivity of thioacetalization
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM (5-bromo-2-nitrophenyl)(tert-butyl)sulfane (32). To a stirred solution of
4-bromo-2-fluoro-1-nitrobenzene (5 g, 22.73 mmol) in DMF (100 mL) was
added 2-methylpropane-2-thiol (2.66 g, 29.49 mmol) and cesium carbonate
(14.8 g, 45.43 mmol). The resulting mixture was stirred at room
temperature overnight. Water was added and the mixture was extracted with
ethyl acetate. The combined organics were washed with brine, dried over
anhydrous Na2SO4, filtered and then the filtrate was concentrated in
vacuo. The residue was purified by chromatography on silica gel with
petroleum/ethyl acetate (50:1) to afford 32. Yellow oil, yield 6.21 g,
94.2%. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.88 (s, 1 H), 7.60 (s, 2 H), 1.37 (s, 9
H). MS (EI) m/z: 289 (M+).

$DATUM 75-09-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Preparation of
Carbamates, Carbonates and/or Thiocarbonates. Method E To a mixture of 1
(200 μmol) and substrate (100 μmol) in CH2C12 (500 μl) was added Et3N
(500 (omol) at rt and stirred for 15-60 min. The organic layer was washed
with 5% NaHCO3 (3 ml x 3). The aqueous layer was back-extracted with
CH2Cl2 (3 ml x 2), and combined organic layer was dried over Na2SO4,
filtered, and evaporated under reduced pressure. The residue was
chromatographed (EtOAc/Hexane, 1:9) to give target compound. Benzyl
phenylcarbamate (12a). O-2,2,2-Trichloroethyl 5-propyl carbonothioate
(23b). This compound was prepared by Method E: 94% yield; colorless oil.
1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 4.83 (2H, s), 2.91 (2H, t, J = 7.3 Hz), 1.71
(2H, tq, J = 7.3, 7.3 Hz), 1.01 (3H, t, J = 7.3 Hz); 13C NMR (100 MHz,
CDCl3) δ 170.5, 94.5, 75.4, 33.3, 23.1, 13.3.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Convenient Method for the Preparation of Carbamates, Carbonates, and
Thiocarbonates
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Shimizu, Mamoru; Sodeoka, Mikiko

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 6-(Ethylthio)-N-(2-(1-phenyl-3-(trifluoromethyl)-1H-pyrazole-4-
carboxanddo)ethyl)nicotinamide A mixture of
6-chloro-N-(2-(1-phenyl-3-(trifluoromethyl)-
1H-pyrazole-4-carboxamido)ethyl)nicotinamide (0.234 g, 0.53 mmol),
sodiiun thioethoxide (0.17 g, 1.6 mmol) and THF (2 mL) was stirred at
80°C for 3 h. After cooling to room temperature, the mixture was diluted
with EtOAc, washed with water and brine, dried and concentrated in vacuo.
The residue was purified by silica gel column chromatography (EtOAc to
EtOAc/MeOH=10/l) to give
6-(ethylthio)-N-(2-{1-phenyl-3-(trifluoromethyl)-1H-pyrazole-
4-carboxamido)ethyl)nicotinamide (0.23 g, 94 %) as colorless crystals:
6-(ethylthio)-N-(2-(1-phenyl-3-(trifluoromethyl)-1H-pyrazole-
4-carboxamido)ethyl)nicotinamide, yield (0.23 g, 94 %) 1H NMR (400MHz,
CDCl3) δ 1.38 (3H, t, J=7.6 Hz), 3.20 (2H, q, J=7.6 Hz), 3.66-3.76 (4H,
m) , 6.77 (1H, br), 7.20 (1H, d, J=8.4 Hz), 7.24 (1H, m), 7.42 (1H, t,
J=7.6 Hz), 7.52 (2H, t, J=7.6 Hz), 7.70 (2H, d, J=7.6 Hz), 7.89 (1H, dd,
J=2.4, 8.4 Hz), 8.44 (1H, d, J=0.4 Hz), 8.86 (1H, d, J=2.4 Hz); m/z (APCI
pos) 464.1 (100 %) (M+H) .

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General procedure B: To oxalyl chloride (1.1
eq) in CH2Cl2 (4 ml/mmol) was added DMSO (2 eq) in CH2Cl2 (1 ml/mmol) via
cannula at -78 °C. The mixture was stirred for 30 minutes at -78 °C.
α-Hydroxyamide (1 eq) in CH2Cl2 (4 ml/mmol) was added via cannula at -78
°C and the mixture was stirred at this temperature for 1 hour.
Triethylamine (5 eq) was added and the mixture allowed to warm to room
temperature. The resulting yellow solution was stirred at room
temperature for 1-26 hours. The organic layer was washed with aqueous
saturated NaHCO3 (×3), dried (Na2SO4) and concentrated in vacuo to yield
crude glyoxamide, usually as a yellow foam. To the crude glyoxamide (1
eq) in CH2Cl2 (12 ml/mmol) was added 1H,1H,2H,2H-perfluorodecane-1- thiol
(0.7 eq) or a non-fluorous thiol (1 eq) and the mixture was stirred at
room temperature for 12-40 hours. Trifluoroacetic anhydride (9 eq) was
added and the mixture was stirred at room temperature for 1 hour before
the addition of BF3·OEt2 (5 eq). After 3-6 hours stirring at room
temperature, during which time the solution adopted an intense colour,
aqueous saturated NaHCO3 was added resulting in vigorous effervescence.
The aqueous layer was extracted with CH2Cl2 (×3). The combined organic
layers were washed with aqueous saturated NaHCO3 (×3), dried (Na2SO4) and
concentrated in vacuo to yield crude spirocycle. Where indicated aqueous
saturated NaHCO3 solution was exchanged for 1M NaOH.
rac-2-iso-Propyl-4-iso-propylsulfanyl-6,10-dimethoxy-2-azaspiro-[4.5]-deca-6,9-
diene-3,8-dione 14 Following general procedure B: Treatment of the crude
glyoxamide 2 (460 mg, 1.56 mmol, 1 eq) with 2-propanethiol (0.15 ml, 1.56
mmol, 1 eq), TFAA (1.98 ml, 14.0 mmol, 9 eq) and BF3·OEt2 (0.98 ml, 7.80
mmol, 5 eq) gave a brown oil. Removal of volatile impurities under high
vacuum afforded spirocycle 14 a yellow oil (495 mg, 1.46 mmol, 94% over 2
steps). δH (500 MHz, CDCl3) 1.13 (3H, d, J = 6.6 Hz, CH3CH), 1.15 (3H, d,
J = 6.6 Hz, CH3CH), 1.17 (3H, d, J = 6.6 Hz, CH3CH), 1.22 (3H, d, J = 6.6
Hz, CH3CH), 3.01 (1H, septet, J = 6.6 Hz, SCH(CH3)2), 3.36 (1H, d, J =
9.6 Hz, CHHN), 3.64 (1H, d, J = 9.6 Hz, CHHN), 3.67 (3H, s, CH3O), 3.81
(3H, s, CH3O), 4.10 (1H, s, CHS), 4.45 (1H, septet, J = 6.6 Hz,
NCH(CH3)2), 5.52 (1H, s, CHCOCH), 5.64 (1H, s, CHCOCH); δC (125 MHz,
CDCl3) 18.9 (CH3CH), 19.5 (CH3CH), 23.1 (CH3CH), 23.6 (CH3CH), 36.1
((CH3)2CHS), 43.8 ((CH3)2CHN), 47.4 (CH2N), 50.6 (C), 52.6 (CHS), 55.8
(CH3O), 56.3 (CH3O), 101.6 (CHCOCH), 103.5 (CHCOCH), 169.1 (C(OCH3)),
169.9 (C(OCH3)), 173.1 (NCO), 187.5 (CO); νmax 2974 and 2941 (CH), 1694
(C=O), 1656 (lactam C=O), 1625 and 1598 (C=C); m/z (ES+) 362 (M+Na,
100%), 340 (MH+, 17%), 133 (42%); C17H25NO4SNa (M+Na) found 362.1390,
expected 362.1397.

$DATUM 64-17-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: The synthesis of trifluoromethylvinyl sulfides
(general procedure). Ethanol (5 mL), KOH (0.34 g, 5.5 mmol), and thiol (6
mmol) were placed in a 25-mL round-bottom flask, and this was stirred for
5 min until complete dissolution of KOH. Then, a solution of the
corresponding styrenes 1 or 2 (5 mmol) in ethanol (5 mL) was added with
vigorous stirring, and the reaction mixture was refluxed for 5-10 min
(TLC monitoring). The reaction mixture was poured in water (100 mL),
extracted with dichloromethane (3×100 mL). The combined extract was
washed with brine and dried with Na2SO4. Dichloromethane was removed in
vacuo, the residue was dissolved in hexane or in the appropriate
hexane-dichloromethane mixture and run through a short layer of silica
gel. Attempted chromatographic separation of isomeric of alkenes failed.
The product was obtained from 1a.
1-Bromo-2-[(1Z)-2-(ethylthio)-3,3,3-trifluoro-1-propenyl]-4-methoxybenzene
(3e) was obtained from 2e. The yield was 94%, colorless oil. Ratio: 1:0.
Found (%): C, 42.33; H, 3.42. C12H12BrF3OS. Calculated (%): C, 42.24; H,
3.55. IR, ν/cm-1: 1620 (C═C). 1H NMR (CDCl3), δ: 1.19 (t, 3 H, SCH2CH3, J
= 7.4 Hz); 2.69 (q, 2 H, SCH2CH3, J = 7.4 Hz); 3.84 (s, 3 H, OCH3), 6.82
(dd, 1 H, Ar, J = 8.8 Hz, J = 2.9 Hz); 7.38 (d, 1 H, Ar, J = 2.9 Hz);
7.50 (d, 1 H, Ar, J = 8.8 Hz); 7.58 (s, 1H, CH═CCF3). 13C NMR (CDCl3), δ:
14.4 (SCH2CH3); 28.3 (SCH2CH3); 55.6 (OCH3); 123.3 (q, CF3, J = 273.7
Hz); 126.7 (q, C-CF3, J = 31.5 Hz); 138.5 (q, CH═CCF3, J = 5.6 Hz);
114.7, 116.2, 116.8, 133.2, 134.7, 158.5 (Ar).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM regioselective, stereoselective
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM New approach to the synthesis of (trifluoromethyl)vinyl sulfides
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Muzalevskiy, V. M.; Shastin, A. V.; Balenkova, E. S.; Nenajdenko, V. G.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Russian Chemical Bulletin (2007), 56(8), 1526-1533

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 5'-Iodide to Alkyl Thioether. Synthesis of
5'-propyl thioether was achieved via a procedure similar to that used to
synthesize the 5'-aryl thioether except that a 1.0 M solution of
1-propanethiol with 0.1 equiv of sodium methoxide in DMF was used and the
reaction was carried out at room tempera- ture for 3-4 min. Synthesis of
5'-dodecyl thioether was achieved via a procedure similar to that used to
synthesize the 5'-aryl thioether except that a 0.5 M solution of
1-dode-canethiol with 0.1 equiv of sodium methoxide in DMF was used and
the reaction was carried out at room temperature for 6 min. Time: 4
minutes, room temperature. Yield: 94.3%.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 2-Propylthionitrobenzene (4a). 25 A solution
of 2-chloronitrobenzene (3a, 15.7 g, 0.10 mol), 1-propanethiol (8.36 g,
0.11 mol), and NaOH (4.4 g, 0.11 mol) in EtOH (50 mL) was stirred for 2 h
at room temperature, and EtOH was evaporated. Water was added, and
organic materials were extracted with CH2Cl2, dried (Na2SO4), and passed
through a silica gel plug. The solvent was removed, and the residue was
Kugelrohr distilled (110 °C/0.3 Torr, lit.25 172 °C/7 Torr).
3-Nitro-2-propylthiopyridine (4b). This compound was prepared from
2-chloro-3-nitropyridine (3b, 4.00 g, 25.2 mmol) as described for 4a. The
crude material was separated by column chromatography (hexanes - CH2Cl2
in 3:2 ratio) followed by recrystallization from hexanes to yield 5b (4.7
g, 94%) of a yellow solid: mp 41-42 °C; 1H NMR δ 1.06 (t, J = 7.3 Hz,
3H), 1.74 (sextet, J = 7.4 Hz, 2H), 3.19 (t, J = 7.3 Hz, 2H), 7.17 (dd,
J1 = 8.2 Hz, J2 = 4.6 Hz, 1H), 8.46 (dd, J1 = 8.3 Hz, J2 = 1.7 Hz, 1H),
8.67 (dd, J1 = 4.6 Hz, J2 = 1.7 Hz, 1H); 13C NMR δ 13.6, 22.0, 32.4,
118.3, 133.6, 142.0, 152.9, 158.4; IR 1587, 1555, 1513 (NO2 asym + ring),
1328 (NO2 sym) cm-1; MS m/z 198 (M+, 5), 107 (100). Anal. Calcd. for
C8H10N2O2S: C, 48.47; H, 5.08; N, 14.13. Found: C, 48.67; H, 5.15; N,
14.12.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DATUM 75-05-8
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Procedure for the Synthesis of Esters
from Thiols. To a stirred mixture of 4,4′-azopyridine (1.2 mmol, 0.216 g)
and acid (1 mmol) in dry CH3CN (3 mL) was added a solution of PPh3 (0.312
g, 1.2 mmol) and thiol (1.3 mmol) in acetonitrile. The reaction mixture
was reﬂuxed for several hours. After completion of the reaction, the
produced pyridine hydrazine was ﬁltered and the solution was concentrated
on a rotary evaporator to give a viscous oil. After puriﬁcation using a
short column of silica gel, the product was obtained. Compound 5e. 5e:
1H-NMR (250 MHz, CDCl3) δ (ppm): 8.21 (2H, d, J = 8.9 Hz), 8.02 (2H, d, J
= 8.9 Hz), 3.01 (2H, t, J = 7.4 Hz), 1.71-1.56 (2H, m), 0.95 (3H, t, J =
7.3 Hz); 13C-NMR (62.9 MHz, CDCl3) δ (ppm): 190.5, 150.4, 141.8, 128.2,
123.8, 31.5, 22.7, 13.4.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Mitsunobu reaction
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Ruthenium-Catalyzed Propargylic Substitution
Reaction of Propargylic Alcohols Bearing Terminal Alkyne Group with
Thiols. A typical experimental procedure for the reaction of
1-phenyl-2-propyn-1-ol (4a) with nBuSH catalyzed by
[Cp*RuCl(μ2-SMe)2RuCp*(OH2)]OTf (1e) is described below. In a 20 mL flask
was placed 1e (23.1 mg, 0.03 mmol) under N2. Anhydrous ClCH2CH2Cl (15 mL)
was added, and then the mixture was magnetically stirred at room
temperature. After the addition of 4a (79.3 mg, 0.60 mmol) and nBuSH (270
mg, 3.00 mmol), the reaction flask was kept at 60 °C for 1 h. The solvent
was concentrated under reduced pressure by an aspirator, and then the
residue was purified by TLC (SiO2) with EtOAc-hexane (1/9) to give butyl
1-phenyl-2-propynyl sulfide (5aa) as a pale yellow oil (106 mg, 0.51
mmol, 86% yield). Butyl 1-(2-naphthyl)-2-propynyl sulfide (5da): Yield
94%. A pale yellow oil. 1H NMR δ 0.86 (t, 3H, J = 7.2 Hz), 1.38 (m, 2H),
1.57 (m, 2H), 2.54 (m, 1H), 2.64 (d, 1H, J = 2.4 Hz), 2.73 (m, 1H), 4.89
(d, 1H, J = 2.4 Hz), 7.45 (m, 2H), 7.60 (dd, 1H, J = 1.8 and 8.4 Hz),
7.79 (m, 3H), 7.92 (s, 1H). 13C NMR δ 13.6, 21.9, 30.8, 31.1, 38.6, 73.9,
81.8, 125.7, 126.1, 126.2, 126.4, 127.6, 127.9, 128.4, 132.8, 132.9,
135.1. HRMS Calcd for C17H19S [M+H] 255.1207. Found 255.1207.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Synthesis of thioethers 8b-f Potassium
carbonate (85 mg, 0.61 mmol, 1.10 equiv.) was added to a solution of
thiol (1.13 equiv.) in DMF (5 mL) and stirred for 15 min at room
temperature. A solution of
9-(2’,3’,5’-tri-O-acetyl-β-D-ribofuranosyl)-2,6-dichloropurine 3 (250 mg,
0.56 mmol, 1 equiv.) in DMF (5 mL) was added and the resulting reaction
mixture was stirred at 35°C (HPLC Control). Then the reaction mixture was
diluted with EtOAc (40 mL) and the organic phase was washed with brine (7
× 25 mL), dried over anh. Na2SO4 and evaporated under reduced pressure.
Silica gel column chromatography (hexane/EtOAc; gradient 33%→66%)
provided product.
9-(2’,3’,5’-Tri-O-acetyl-β-D-ribofuranosyl)-2-chloro-6-but-1-ylthio-9H-purine
(8d): acolourless oil. R f = 0.51 (toluene/EtOAc = 1:2). IR (KBr): 2960,
2935, 2874, 1748, 1562, 1433, 1371, 1337, 1224, 1148, 1097, 1048; 1H-NMR
(300 MHz, CDCl3) δ (ppm): 8.08 (s, 1H, H-C(8)), 6.15 (d, 1H, 3 J 1'-2' =
5.7 Hz, H-C(1’)), 5.76 (dd, 1H, 3 J 1'-2' = 5.7 Hz, 3 J 2'-3' = 5.3 Hz,
H-C(2’)), 5.55 (dd, 1H, 3 J 2'-3' = 5.3 Hz, 3 J 3'-4' = 4.5 Hz, H-C(3’)),
4.44-4.38 (m, 1H, H-C(4’)), 4.37-4.31 (m, 2H,-H2C(5’)), 3.32 (t, 2H, 3 J
= 7.2 Hz,-CH2-), 2.10, 2.08, 2.03 (3s, 9H, H3COOC-C(2’,3’,5’)), 1.71
(quintet, 2H, 3 J = 7.2 Hz, (-CH2-)), 1.44 (sextet, 2H, 3 J = 7.2 Hz,
(-CH2-)), 0.91 (t, 3H, 3 J = 7.2 Hz, (-CH3)); 13C-NMR (75.5 MHz, CDCl3) δ
(ppm): 170.2, 169.5, 169.3, 164.4, 153.8, 149.3, 141.0, 130.6, 86.0,
80.6, 73.1, 70.6, 62.9, 31.1, 28.9, 21.8, 20.7, 20.5, 20.3, 13.5; HRMS
(ESI) calcd for C20H26N4O7Cl [M+H]+, 501.1205; found 501.1189.

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: General Method for Radical Elongations. A
solution of a pent-4-enyl glycoside (0.5 mmol), AIBN (0.1-0.25 mmol) and
thioacetic acid, 2-mercaptoethanol, butanethiol, or
2-[(tertbutoxycarbonyl) amino]-1-ethanethiol (7.5 mmol) in 1,4-dioxane (4
mL) was thoroughly degassed (N2) before reacted at 75 °C (preheated
oilbath). After stirring for 1-4 h, the reaction was quenched with
cyclohexene (0.3 mL), concentrated and coconcentrated twice with toluene.
The residue was then subjected to flash chromatography to yield the
sulfide spacer derivative. 5-(Thiobutyl)pentyl
2,3,4,6-Tetra-O-acetyl-δ-D-glucopyranoside (14). This compound was
prepared according to the general procedure starting from 2 (111 mg, 0.27
mmol), AIBN (9 mg, 0.05 mmol), and butanethiol (427 μL, 3.99 mmol).
Purification by flash chromatography gave 14 (126 mg, 0.25 mmol, 94%)
[α]D -15.7° (c 1.3, CHCl3); 1H NMR (CDCl3, selected data): δ 0.91 (t,
3H), 1.36-1.61 (m, 10H), 2.50 (t, 4H), 3.48 (m, 1H), 4.85 (m, 1H), 4.49
(d, 1H, J = 7.69 Hz); 13C NMR (CDCl3) δ 13.6, 20.5, 20.6, 20.7, 22.0,
25.1, 29.0, 29.3, 31.7, 31.8, 32.0, 61.9, 68.4, 69.8, 71.3, 72.8, 100.8,
169.2, 169.3, 170.2, 170.6. Anal. Calcd for C23H38O10S: C, 54.53; H,
7.56; S, 6.33. Found: C, 54.65; H, 7.69; S, 6.37.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE

Functionalities

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: 3. General reaction procedure for asymmetric
1,4-conjugate addition with 4f To a solution of 5 (0.2 mmol) and catalyst
QD-4f (15.0 or 30.0 mg, 0.02 or 0.04 mmol) in chloroform (0.4 mL) was
added thiol 6 (0.6mmol, 3 equiv.). The reaction mixture was kept at -20°C
or -50°C for 72 h, and then was filtered through a short plug of silica
gel. The silica gel plug was washed with diethyl ether (5.0 mL). The
filtrate was concentrated in vacuo, and the residue was subjected to
flash chromatography (SiO2) to give product 7.
3-(3-(benzylthio)butanoyl)oxazolidin-2-one
3-(3-(allylthio)-3-(3-fluorophenyl)propanoyl)oxazolidin-2-one The crude
product was purified by by flash chromatography (SiO2, hexanes/ethyl
acetate = 2/1) to give compound 7t as a colorless oil in 94% yield and
92% ee [determined by HPLC, chiral OD, hexanes: isopropanol = 80:20, 1.0
mL/min, λ = 220 nm, t (major) = 17.7 min, t (minor) = 15.7 min]. [α]D 25
= +109.0 (c 0.5, CHCl3); 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 2.89-2.94 (m, 1H),
3.01-3.06 (m, 1H), 3.46-3.58 (m, 2H), 3.90-4.03 (m, 2H), 4.33-4.44 (m,
3H), 5.04-5.12 (m, 2H), 5.71-5.78 (m, 1H), 6.92-6.96 (m, 1H), 7.10-7.17
(m, 2H), 7.26-7.31 (m, 1H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, MeOH) δ 34.28, 41.49,
42.42, 42.91, 62.13, 114.24, 114.46, 114.87, 115.09, 117.63, 123.76,
129.92, 130.00, 133.85, 144.21, 153.38, 170.02; HRMS (CI/[M+Na+MeOH]+)
Calcd. for: C16H20O4NFNaS: 364.0995. Found: 364.0990.

$DATUM 872-50-4
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: A General procedure for decarboxylative C?S
coupling. To a solution of N-methyl-2-pyrrolidone (NMP) (3 mL) charged
with phenylpropiolic acid (0.5 mmol) and thiol (0.75 mmol) was added CuI
(3.8 mg, 0.02 mmol) and Cs2CO3 (391 mg, 1.2 mmol). The resulting mixture
was stirred at 90 °C. Upon completion of the reaction (approx. 24 hr),
the mixture was cooled to room temperature, poured into a solution of HCl
in water (1 N, 15 mL), and extracted several times with 15 mL of ethyl
acetate. The combined organic layers were washed with water and brine,
dried over Na2SO4, and filtered. The solvent was removed in vacuo and the
residue was purified by column chromatography (silica gel, eluent:
hexane/ethyl acetate) to afford the coupling product.
(4-Bromostyryl)(octyl)sulfane (3ad, Z/E = 68:32). Obtained as a light
yellow liquid in 94% yield. 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.50-7.13 (m, 4H),
6.73 (d, 0.32 × 1H), 6.42-6.26 (m, 1.68H), 2.79 (t, 2H), 1.69 (quint,
2H), 1.41-1.28 (m, 10H), 0.89 (t, 3H); 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3) δ 136.1,
136.0, 131.6, 131.3, 130.1, 129.8, 128.8, 128.3, 126.9. 126.5, 124.0,
120.2, 35.9, 32.6, 31.8, 30.2, 29.4, 29.1, 28.7, 28.5, 22.6, 14.0; HR
EIMS: 326.0699 m/z (calcd. for C16H23BrS: 326.0704).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM stereoselective
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Synthesis of vinyl sulfides by copper-catalyzed decarboxylative C-S
cross-coupling
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Ranjit, Sadananda; Duan, Zhongyu; Zhang, Pengfei; Liu, Xiaogang
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Organic Letters (2010), 12(18), 4134-4136

$DATUM 64-17-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: As a typical procedure, MPC (10 mmol) and
1-alkanethiol (10 mmol) were mixed together in ethanol (20 mL) after
which Ar gas bubbling was performed for 15 min. Diisopropylamine (DIPA: 4
mol %) was added to the solution as a catalyst. After stirring for 20 h
at room temperature, ethanol was evaporated under vacuum, and the residue
was washed with hexane to remove nonreacted 1-alkanethiol compounds. The
products were extracted by tetrahydrofuran (THF) or acetone to remove the
unreacted MPC, and then, the solvent was evaporated under vacuum.
Finally, the samples were freeze-dried. The structure of products was
characterized by 1H NMR (300 MHz NMR spectrometer: JEOL Ltd., Tokyo,
Japan) and FT-IR spectroscopy (JASCO, Co., Tokyo, Japan). C8-S-PC: yield
94.2% 1H NMR (CD3OD, 300 MHz): δ = 0.87-0.91 (CH3CH2CH2-, 3H), 1.21-1.37
(-CH(CH3)C(=O) and CH3(CH2)5CH2-, 13H), 1.53-1.58 (-CH2CH2CH2S-, 2H),
2.49-2.78 (-CH2CH2SCH2CH(CH3)-, 5H), 3.22 (-N(CH3), 9H), 3.61-3.64
(-CH2N, 2H), 4.03-4.09 (POCH2-, 2H), and 4.24-4.29 (OCH2CH2OP, 4H). FT-IR
(KBr, cm-1): 2957, 2926, 2854 (C-H), 1732 (C=O), 1250 (P=O), 1088
(-OPOCH2-), 966 (-N+ (CH3)3-).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM combinatorial, Michael addition
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Simple Synthesis of a Library of Zwitterionic Surfactants via
Michael-Type Addition of Methacrylate and Alkane Thiol Compounds

$DATUM Matsuno, Ryosuke; Takami, Kimiaki; Ishihara, Kazuhiko
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Langmuir (2010), 26(16), 13028-13032

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Typical Procedure for the Synthesis of
3-Isopropenyl-6-methyl-2-phenyltetrahydrothiopyran (3a, Table 1).
6-Methyl-hept-5-ene-2-thiol (86 mg, 0.6 mmol) in 2 mL of toluene was
added dropwise to a stirring mixture of benzaldehyde (53 mg, 0.5 mmol),
boron trifluoride etherate (63 μL, 0.5 mmol), and toluene (2 mL) at 0°C.
The stirring was continued at the same temperature for 30 min, and then
the mixture was poured into saturated NaHCO3 (5 mL). The reaction mixture
was extracted with ethyl acetate and then washed with brine and water.
The organic layers were collected, dried over Na2SO4, filtered, and
concentrated. Then the resultant crude residue was purified by column
chromatography over silica gel (petroleum ether/ EtOAc 98:2).
2-(4-Bromophenyl)tetrahydro-6-methyl-3-(prop-1-en-2-yl)- 2H-thiopyran
(3d): colorless liquid (146 mg, 94%). 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 1.20 (d,
J= 7.2 Hz, 3 H), 1.48 (s, 3 H), 1.50-1.60 (m, 2 H), 1.90-1.97 (m, 1 H),
2.08-2.12 (m, 1 H), 2.56 (dt, J= 11.2 and 2.8 Hz, 1 H), 2.96-3.05 (m, 1
H), 3.86 (d, J= 10.8 Hz, 1 H), 4.57-4.59 (m, 2 H), 7.15 (d, J= 8.4 Hz, 2
H), 7.38 (d, J= 8.0 Hz, 2 H); 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3) δ 20.3, 21.1,
33.7, 37.1, 39.9, 50.3, 51.6, 112.6, 121.0, 130.0, 131.6, 139.9, 147.1;
IR (KBr, neat) 2960, 2922, 1644, 1448, 1374, 1074, 1010, 890, 771 cm-1;
HRMS (APCI) calcd for C15H19BrS (M + H)+ requires 311.0464, found
311.0464.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM stereoselective, Prins cyclization

$DATUM 68-12-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Typical Procedure Reactions were carried out in a test tube (20 mL) under
an N2 atmosphere with gentle magnetic stirring. Phenol (18 mmol),
catalyst (2 mmol), paraformaldehyde (0.9 g, 30 mmol), and n-dodecanethiol
(4.04 g, 20 mmol) in N,N-dimethylformamide (4.0 g) was heated at
100-160°C. After completion of the reaction, the mixture was cooled to
room temperature, washed with water, and dried. Then the yellowish
products were analyzed using 1H NMR.
2,6-Di-tert-butyl-4-((dodecylthio)methyl)phenol (yellowish oil), yield
94% 1H NMR (CDCl3): 7.068 (s, 2H, C6H2), 5.103 (s, 1H, Ph-OH), 3.636 (s,
2H, PhCH2S), 2.442-2.405 (t, J = 1.2, 2H, PhCH2SCH2), 1.569-1.530 [(m,
2H, SCH2CH2), 1.398 (s, 18H, C(CH3)3), 1.280-1.234 [m, 18H, (CH2)9],
0.878-0.844 (t, J = 6.8, 3H, CH2CH3).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Catalytic thioalkylation of phenols based on Mannich-type phenol
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Liu, Peng; Zhu, Lunyu; Fang, Yan; Zhang, Huaiping; Chen, Dehong; He, Tao;
Chen, Mingcai; Xu, Kai
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM Synthetic Communications (2007), 37(15), 2609-2613

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Dodecanethiol-1 (81 g, 0.40 mol) and KOH (8.87 g, 0.12 mol) in ethanol
(90 mL) were refluxed under an inert atmosphere, treated dropwise with
formalin (81 mL, 0.80 mol), refluxed for 2 h, neutralized with HCl, and
treated with hot water. The organic layer was separated, treated with hot
water (250 mL, 60 °C), stirred vigorously, and cooled to room
temperature. The resulting crystals were filtered off, dried, and
recrystallized from petroleum ether to afford. Yield: (129 g, 94%). mp
57-58°C. PMR spectrum (δ, ppm): 0.68[3H, t, (CH2)11Me], 1.24 [18H, m,
(CH2)9Me], 1.54 (2H, m, CH2C10H21), 2.21 (6H, s, Ar-Me), 2.40 (2H, t,
CH2C11H23), 3.58 (2H, s, ArCH2S), 4.54 (1H, s, OH), 6.89 (2H, s, Ar),
C21H36OS.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM formaldehyde has been added

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):PRO(1):YIELD
$DATUM 94
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):RGT(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 1310-73-2
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):SOL(1):CAS_RN
$DATUM 7732-18-5
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Sodium mercaptide (1.2 mol) as 20 % solution in water was placed into a
flask and 40 g (1 mol) of NaOH (solid) was added under stirring. The
mixture was intensively stirred and 155 g (1 mol) of ground
(2S)-2-ammoniopropylsulfate was added within 30 min. The mixture was then
stirred for 5-10 h at 90°C and cooled to 30°C. The upper organic layer
was separated to give 159 g of the product
(2S)-1-(methylthio)propane-2-amine with a purity of 62 % (38 % water
content). The product can be dried over MgSO4or azeotropically with
Hexane to give 102 g (94 % of theory) of the amine with purity of 97 %.
B.p. 154°C.
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):NOTES
$DATUM Reactant assumed
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Preparation of thioalkylamines with high yields
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):AUTHOR
$DATUM Pazenok, Sergiy
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):CITATION
$DATUM World Intellectual Property Organization, WO2007022900 A1 2007-03-01

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM Synthesis and characterization of Pd(CyPF-tBu)(StBu)(C6H4-4-Me) (4a). A
solution of 8.6 mg (0.011 mmol) of Pd(CyPF-tBu)(OH)(C6H4-4-Me) (5) and
1,3,5- trioxane (internal standard) in 0.45 mL of THF-d8 was placed into
an NMR tube with a septum-lined screw-cap. A 1H NMR spectrum was
recorded. The sample was cooled to - 40°C, and 1.4 μL (0.012 mmol) of
2-methyl-2-propanethiol were added. The sample was quickly placed into a
precooled NMR spectrometer probe at -40°C. The arylpalladium thiolate
complex 4a was formed in 94% yield. This complex was characterized by NMR
spectroscopy at -40°C. Pd(CyPF-tBu)(StBu)(C6H4-4-Me) (4a), yield 94%. 1H
NMR (THF-d8): 7.63 (virtual t, J = 6.9 Hz, 1H), 7.20 (virtual t, J = 6.7
Hz, 1H), 6.81 (d, J = 7.4 Hz, 1H), 6.68 (d, J = 7.6 Hz, 1H), 4.98 (br s,
1H), 4.65 (br s, 1H), 4.48 (br s, 1H), 3.98 (s, 5H), 3.11 (m, 1H), 3.01
(m, 1H), 2.68 (m 1H), 2.19 (s, 3H), 2.25-0.98 (m, 23H), 1.62 (d, J = 11.0
Hz, 18 H), 0.89 (s, 9H). 31P{1H} NMR (THF-d8): δ 68.5 (d, J = 38.2 Hz),
12.5 (d, J = 33.3 Hz).

$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):EXP_PROC
$DATUM 3-Ethylthiotetrahydrofuran. Ethyl mercaptan (12.43 g, 0.1 mol) was added
to a mixture of 2,3-dihydrofuran (7.00 g, 0.1 mol) and benzoyl peroxide
(0.1 g) at room temperature. An increase in temperature was observed
after 5 min and the mixture was kept at 25-30 °C by cooling with water.
After 1 h, no further increase of temperature was observed. The mixture
was left overnight and the product was isolated by distillation: 24.85 g
(94%). bp 46 °C/0.1 mmHg, n20D = 1.4866 (lit. bp 106-108 °C/35 mmHg, n20D
= 1.4930); 1H NMR (CDCl3) δ 1.28 (t, J = 6 Hz, 3H, CH3), 1.83 (m, 1H,
CH2), 2.28 (m, 1H, CH2), 2.60 (q, J = 6 Hz, 2H, CH2), 3.35 (m, 1H, CH),
3.58 (dd, J = 6 Hz, 6.5 Hz, 1H, CH2), 3.83 (m, 1H, CH2), 3.91 (m, 1H,
CH2), 4.08 (dd, J = 6 Hz, 6.5 Hz, 1H, CH2).
$DTYPE RXN:VAR(1):REFERENCE(1):TITLE
$DATUM Molecular Addition Compounds. 17. Borane and Chloroborane Adducts with
Organic Sulfides for Hydroboration

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure: Addition of alkanethiols to complex 1 (general
procedure). K2CO3 (7.87 g, 5.72 mmol) or NaOH (2.28 g, 572 mmol) and RSH
(3.4 mmol) were added to a solution of complex 1 (14.6 g, 2.86 mmol) in
MeCN or DMF (50 mL) under At. The reaction mixture was stirred at 40-45°C
The course of the reaction can be monitored by 1HNMR spectroscopy by
following the disappearance of signals for the protons at the C=C bond
Cat i5 5.85 is) and 4.1 (s)L by speetrophotometry (400--430 nm), and by
TLC on silica gel using the 3 : 1 CHCI3-Me2CO solvent system. After the
attainment of thermodynamic equilibrium (the ratio of the diastereomeric
complexes ceased to change: TLC control), the reaction mixture was
filtered, the precipitate was washed with CHCI3, and the solution was
concentrated to dryness. The chemical yields of the products and the
ratios of the diastereomers are given in Table 1.
[(S)-BPB-(R)-(S-ButCys)Ni 11 (4). 1H NMR (CDCl3), 8:1.32 (s, 9 H, CMe3);
1.96-.16 (m, 2 H, Pro): 2.42--2.60 (m, I H, Pro); 2.55 (dd, 1 H, CH2S,
JAB = 11.82 Ha, JaX = 5.77 Hz); 2.77 (dd. I H, CH2S. JAB = 11.82 Hz, JBX
= 2.60 Hz); 4.29 (dd, 1H, HC-CH2S, JXA = 5.77 Hz, JXB = 2.60 Hz);

3.62 AB system, ∆δ 0.82, 2 H, CH2Ph, JAB = 11.54 Hz): 3.6-2.9 (m, 2 H,

$DATUM General/Typical Procedure:
((2-Fluoro-3,4-dihydronaphthalen-1-yl)methyl)(phenyl)sulfane (24) -
General protocol: (Scheme 3) To a solution of thiophenol (61.1 mg, 0.56
mmol, 2 equiv) in THF (1 mL) was added dropwise n-BuLi (0.22 mL, 0.56
mmol, 2.5 M in hexane, 2 equiv.) at 0 °C, and the resulting lithium
thiolate was stirred for 30 min while reaching room temperature.
Meanwhile, a stirred solution of 1 (50.0 mg, 0.28 mmol, 1 equiv) was
prepared in THF (1 mL). The lithium thiolate solution was added to 1 and
the mixture was heated at 66 °C. After 4 h, the mixture was cooled,
poured into satd. aq. Na2CO3 and extracted with Et2O (3X). The combined
organic layers were washed with brine, dried over MgSO4, and
concentrated. Purification by flash chromatography using 2% Et2O/hexane
as the eluent afforded 24.
Tert-butyl((2-fluoro-3,4-dihydronaphthalen-1-yl)methyl)sulfane (27). The
general protocol was followed on a 0.28 mmol scale of 1 using
t-butylmercaptan. The desired product (65.3 mg, 94%) was obtained as a
colorless liquid without further purification. IR (neat) ν = 3060, 2959,
2897, 1678, 1489, 1363, 1225, 1181, 1149, 1068, 955, 763, 744, 691 cm-1;
1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3) δ 7.35-7.12 (m, 4H), 3.70 (s, 2H), 2.98 (td, 2H,
J = 8.3, 2.6 Hz), 2.61- 2.56 (m, 2H), 1.44 (s, 9H); 19F NMR (376 MHz,
CDCl3) δ -101.9 (s); 13C NMR (75 MHz, CDCl3) δ 159.3 (d, JC-F = 269 Hz),
133.3, 132.9, 127.4, 126.8, 126.3 (d, JC-F = 2.0 Hz), 123.5 (d, JC-F =
6.8 Hz), 111.8, 42.9, 30.7, 28.5 (d, JC-F = 6.9 Hz), 25.0 (d, JC-F = 24.9
Hz), 21.8 (d, JC-F = 5.8 Hz); HRMS-ESI calcd for C15H19FS [M+H]+
251.1264, found 251.1260.
